docTitle.titlePart:
Anionic Poly(񮽙-caprolactam): Relationships among Conditions of
Synthesis, Chain Regularity, Reticular Order, and Polymorphism

byline.affiliation: Dipartimento di Chimica e Chimica Industriale (DCCI), Universita i Genova,
Istituto di Ricerca e Tecnologia delle Materie Plastiche-C.N.R.,

front.note: Received June 7, 1999; Revised Manuscript Received September 1, 1999
front.div:
ABSTRACT: Anionic poly(񮽙-caprolactam), isothermally synthesized at temperatures between 155 and
195 Â°C by very fast carbamoyl-type activators, has been characterized by UV, DSC, and wide-angle X-ray
scattering (WAXS) techniques in terms of high polymer yield, irregular structures along the chain, extent
of cross-linking, Tg and Tm values, degree of crystallinity, and polymorphism. The specific role of four
different activators on the above properties has been compared. From the whole set of characterization
data it is evident that cyclohexylcarbamoylcaprolactam behaves as the most suitable activator and provides
poly(񮽙-caprolactam) with properties that favorably match those of the corresponding hydrolytic polyamide.
